alert.note: Alert for Bennington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 3:59PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Washington and west central Bennington Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 359 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Salem, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Arlington, Salem, Shaftsbury, Sunderland, Sandgate, Glastenbury, Battenville, Chiselville, South Shaftsbury, Rexleigh, East Arlington, Eagleville, Anaquassacook, Hidden Valley, Fitch Point, East Kansas, Sunderland Station, Bouplon Corner, Ash Grove and Shushan. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
